IP.Name: LIBJPEG
IP.About: LIBJPEG: C library for reading and writing JPEG image files

RefParameter.Name: LIBJPEG_FS_type
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : FatFS
This parameter specifies the type of data manager used for compressed data storage (source and destination) when the "stream" data management Api is used :
-FatFS : FatFS File system
-Stdio : standard "stdio" stream manager
-None : No file system interfacing

RefParameter.Name: LIBJPEG_FS_type
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : "FatFS Ronly"
This parameter specifies the type of data manager used for compressed data storage (source and destination) when the "stream" data management Api is used :
-FatFS Ronly : FatFS File system - "Read Only" mode
-Stdio : standard "stdio" stream manager
-None : No file system interfacing

RefParameter.Name: LIBJPEG_FS_type
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Stdio
This parameter specifies the type of data manager used for compressed data storage (source and destination) when the "stream" data management Api is used :
-Stdio : standard "stdio" stream manager
-None : No file system interfacing

RefParameter.Name: FREERTOS
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter indicates if FreeRtos is Disabled or Enabled :
-when FreeRtos is Disabled, the LibJpeg memory allocator is the C standard allocator (not configurable).
-when FreeRtos is Enabled, the LibJpeg memory allocator type can be configured in "General Settings" menu.

RefParameter.Name: FREERTOS
RefParameter.Description:
This parameter indicates if FreeRtos is Disabled or Enabled :
-when FreeRtos is Disabled, the LibJpeg memory allocator is the C standard allocator (not configurable).
-when FreeRtos is Enabled, the LibJpeg memory allocator type can be configured in "General Settings" menu.

RefParameter.Name: HAVE_BOOLEAN
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Undefined
Defines/Undefines the HAVE_BOOLEAN C condition allowing to change the boolean type.
When conflicting with application specific header files the boolean type can be redefined by defining the HAVE_BOOLEAN condition.
In this case the boolean type takes the value of the field 'boolean type'.

RefParameter.Name: BooleanType
RefParameter.Description: Set the boolean type to the specified value.

RefParameter.Name: LIBJPEG_with_FREERTOS
RefParameter.Description: FreeRtos is Enabled : this parameter allows to select FreeRtos Memory Allocator (value Enabled) or the C standard memory allocator (value Disabled) for LibJpeg memory allocations.

RefParameter.Name: LIBJPEG_with_FREERTOS
RefParameter.Description: FreeRtos is Disabled : LibJpeg memory allocator is the C standard memory allocator.

RefParameter.Name: BITS_IN_JSAMPLE
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : 8 bits
Define BITS_IN_JSAMPLE as either:
- 8 for 8-bit sample values (the usual setting)
- 12 for 12-bit sample values
Only 8 and 12 are legal data precisions for lossy JPEG according to the JPEG standard, and the IJG code does not support anything else.
Warning:
-when selecting 12 bits data precision (BITS_IN_JSAMPLE = 12), it is recommended to enable "ENTROPY_OPT_SUPPORTED" when encoder is used (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: MAX_COMPONENTS
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : 10
Define maximum number of components (color channels) allowed in JPEG image
To meet the letter of the JPEG spec, set this to 255. However, darn few applications need more than 4 channels (maybe 5 for CMYK + alpha mask). We recommend 10 as a reasonable compromise; use 4 if you are really short on memory. (Each allowed component costs a hundred or so bytes of storage, whether actually used in an image or not.)

RefParameter.Name: JCOEF
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : short
Define representation of a DCT frequency coefficient.
This should be a signed value of at least 16 bits; "short" is usually OK. Again, we allocate large arrays of these, but you can change to int if you have memory to burn and "short" is really slow.

RefParameter.Name: DCT_ISLOW_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Group: JPEG encoder and decoder common capabilities options
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Slow but accurate integer algorithm

RefParameter.Name: DCT_IFAST_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Group: JPEG encoder and decoder common capabilities options
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Faster, less accurate integer method

RefParameter.Name: DCT_FLOAT_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Group: JPEG encoder and decoder common capabilities options
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Floating-point: accurate, fast on fast HW

RefParameter.Name: C_ARITH_CODING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Arithmetic coding back end

RefParameter.Name: C_MULTISCAN_FILES_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Multiple-scan JPEG files

RefParameter.Name: C_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Progressive JPEG (Requires MULTISCAN)
Warnings:
-"Progressive encoding" requires to enable "C_MULTISCAN_FILES_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details)
-when "Progressive encoding" is enabled, it is recommended to enable "ENTROPY_OPT_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details)

RefParameter.Name: C_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Progressive JPEG (Requires MULTISCAN)
Warnings:
-"Progressive encoding" requires to enable "C_MULTISCAN_FILES_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details)
-when "Progressive encoding" is enabled, it is recommended to enable "ENTROPY_OPT_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details)

RefParameter.Name: DCT_SCALING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Input rescaling via DCT (Requires DCT_ISLOW)
Warning:
"DCT scaling" requires to enable "DCT_ISLOW_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: DCT_SCALING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Input rescaling via DCT (Requires DCT_ISLOW)
Warning:
"DCT scaling" requires to enable "DCT_ISLOW_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: ENTROPY_OPT_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Optimization of entropy coding parms
Warning:
-when "ENTROPY_OPT_SUPPORTED" is disabled it is recommended to set data precision to 8-bit (BITS_IN_JSAMPLE = 8) and to disable "C_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED" - (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: INPUT_SMOOTHING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Input image smoothing option

RefParameter.Name: D_ARITH_CODING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Arithmetic coding back end

RefParameter.Name: D_MULTISCAN_FILES_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Multiple-scan JPEG files

RefParameter.Name: D_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Progressive JPEG (Requires MULTISCAN)
Warning:
-"Progressive decoding" requires to enable "D_MULTISCAN_FILES_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: D_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Progressive JPEG (Requires MULTISCAN)
Warning:
-"Progressive decoding" requires to enable "D_MULTISCAN_FILES_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: IDCT_SCALING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Output rescaling via IDCT

RefParameter.Name: SAVE_MARKERS_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
jpeg_save_markers() needed

RefParameter.Name: BLOCK_SMOOTHING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Block smoothing (Progressive only)
Warning:
-"Block smoothing" requires to enable "D_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: BLOCK_SMOOTHING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Block smoothing (Progressive only)
Warning:
-"Block smoothing" requires to enable "D_PROGRESSIVE_SUPPORTED" (cf "jmorecfg.h" for details).

RefParameter.Name: UPSAMPLE_SCALING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Disabled
Output rescaling at upsample stage

RefParameter.Name: UPSAMPLE_MERGING_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
Fast path for sloppy upsampling

RefParameter.Name: QUANT_1PASS_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
1-pass color quantization

RefParameter.Name: QUANT_2PASS_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : Enabled
2-pass color quantization

RefParameter.Name: RGB_ORDERING
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : RGB
Ordering of RGB data in scanlines passed to or from the application
Only R/G/B and B/G/R orders are possible
Refer to "LibJPEG/jquant2.c" for details

RefParameter.Name: RGB_PIXELSIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Default Value : 3
JSAMPLEs per RGB scanline element.
To deal with formats such as R,G,B,X one extra byte per pixel) by changing RGB_PIXELSIZE. Note that changing the offsets will also change the order in which colormap data is organized.
RESTRICTIONS:
1. The sample applications cjpeg,djpeg do NOT support modified RGB formats.
2. The color quantizer modules will not behave desirably if RGB_PIXELSIZE is not 3 (they don't understand about dummy color components!). So you can't use color quantization if you change that value.
